function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Noisy precision \\/ recall curve may make it difficult to estimate model performance for object detection.","Impact":"Misleading performance assessment and inaccurate evaluation of detection model effectiveness.","Mitigation":"Use smoothing techniques to manage noise in the precision \\/ recall curve before calculating area under the curve (AUC).","Technologies":"Smoothing algorithms, such as moving average or Gaussian filter, can be applied to the curve data for noise reduction.","People":"Data scientists, machine learning engineers, researchers","Owner":"Data science teams, research teams"},{"Description":"Change in computation method for AP by PASCAL VOC challenge may lead to discrepancies in model evaluation.","Impact":"Inconsistent evaluation metrics across different time periods, making it challenging to compare model performance over time.","Mitigation":"Be aware of computation method changes and standardize evaluation process according to the latest guidelines.","Technologies":"Stay updated with benchmarking challenges and adhere to the latest evaluation protocols.","People":"Machine learning practitioners, researchers","Owner":"Research teams, benchmarking organizations"},{"Description":"Use of multiple detection models may lead to varied performance results and difficulty in comparing model effectiveness.","Impact":"Inconsistent assessment of object detection models, making it challenging to determine the best-performing model for a specific task.","Mitigation":"Perform thorough comparative analysis and consider using ensemble methods to combine predictions from multiple models for improved accuracy.","Technologies":"Ensemble learning techniques, model fusion approaches","People":"Machine learning engineers, data scientists","Owner":"Research teams, data science teams"}]}
